result.execSummary:
The defendant Trevor R. Christian was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Trevor R. Christian

records.addlTxt: of right to seek postconviction relief

03:27 PM Defendant Trevor R. Christian in court in custody with attorney Steven G. Richards. Prosecuting Atty Curtis Johnson appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Court hears Johnson - he moves to amended both counts to dismiss the repeater enhancement; so ordered.    Court verbally reviews charges/penalties of amended counts with the defendant.  Defendant pleads no contest to amended counts.  Victim contact related.  Jury trial waived.  Defendant sworn.    Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form - colloquy given.  Defendant freely, willingly, knowledgeably and intelligently enters into the plea agreement and joint recommendation.
Court finds defendant guilty of both Counts as amended.  Court hears counsel, both request court adopt joint recommendation and give reasons.  Court enters sentence as follows:  Sentence Withheld, 2 years probation concurrent to all other counts, but consecutive to the federal sentence he is serving.  Probation begins at the conclusion fo the federal sentence.  Costs (including CPS fees) are all waived.  Counseling is ordered as recommendated by the agent.  Notice of Right to Seek Post Conviction Relief filed.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 27, 2019 at 03:00 pm.
ADA Matt Allen appears for STate.  Atty Steven Richards appears for defendant who is not in court.  Defendant has entered pleas in federal court.  Plea & sentencing August 27, 2019 at 3:00 pm.
Status conference on May 13, 2019 at 04:15 pm.

11:15 AM Defendant Trevor R. Christian in court with attorney Steven G. Richards.  Defendant Trevor R. Christian in custody.  Larry Eugene Nelson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant wishes to waive preliminary hearing.  Waiver accepted.    Court verbally reviews charges/penalties with the defendant. Not guilty plea entered.  Atty Richards state that defenant is charged federally in the western district and would like a status in May.  Expects sentencing in ferderal court in late summer.  No objectioon by State.  STC May 13,2019 at 4:15 pm.
Status conference on April 4, 2019 at 11:15 am.
01:27 PM Attorney Steven G. Richards in court via phone.  Matthew C. Allen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Status conference scheduled for April 4, 2019 at 11:15 am.
